intro: Brachistus hookerianus, commonly known as Hooker's bristlebush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. Brachistus hookerianus is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
